metadata.title: CVE-2018-16862 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A security flaw was found in the Linux kernel in a way that the cleancachesubsystem clears an inode after the final file truncation (removal). Thenew file created with the same inode may contain leftover pages fromcleancache and the old file data instead of the new one.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1043-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1043.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1060-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1060.66
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gke - 4.15.0-1040.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1014-azure - 5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1042-kvm - 4.15.0-1042.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-oem - 4.15.0-1050.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1021-oracle - 4.15.0-1021.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1043.46').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.66').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1042.42').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.57').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23').
